通关留爪。。。
保持着高度紧绷的神经去玩这款游戏，体验到了3.4小时内脑细胞极速死亡的快感（？？），在熬到最后听到glados小姐姐（？？）的still alive的时候，立马就呼出了一口气。总的来说游戏并不是很难，但是对我这种解谜游戏不感兴趣的玩家来说，这游戏的确很有趣。强烈的代入感以及穿越传送门时的视觉刺激给我带来了极大的乐趣........
该不愧说是v社的看家ip之一么.......

짧아서 좋다

[h1][u]Un portal, Des portaux [/u] [/h1]


Bon, alors, qu’est ce qu’on peut dire sur un classique du jeux vidéo ?
Hein ? Qu’est ce qu’on peut dire ?
Bon alors déjà :

IL…il y a….y a un bon gameplay…et…..et … et un bon scénario….

Mouais, bon alors résumons.

On joue un personnage aussi bruyant qu’un politicien muet.
Ce personnage se retrouve enfermer a devoir suivre des expérience expérimental par des portail le permettent de se télé porter via les murs.

Le jeu se porte donc sur un système assez intuitif, avec des énigme ni trop a la [i]Tomb Raider[/i], ni trop a la [i]Dora L'exploratrice[/i], donc une bonne gestion de la difficulté.

Le tout avec un lvl design assez bien travailler, varier de blanc et de gris…


[h1][u]Port Aie [/u] [/h1]


Bon, je résume franchement, très brièvement, il y a un plein de petit élément très amusant, comme les tourelles a la voix d’un chaton, le gâteau, et compagnie.

Mais franchement, je veux pas vous gâchez ce petit jeu, certes assez court, mais qui en vos la chandelle, alors, non, je vous laisse découvrir, je vous le conseil que trop bien.


[h1][u]-clusion                                                                                                            -Con [/u] [/h1]
                                                                                                                                                                

Assez court, mais vaut son prix d’or, pour son scénrio original (inspirer de l’odyssé de l’espace quand même, sa se voit grandement quand même), mais un gameplay très intéressent avec des situation pour le moins varier et ni trop dur, ni trop facile

9/10

Portal is a [u]classic[/u] and always will be. Shorter and easier than Portal 2, but definitely more charming. 

This is a game every gamer should at least play once. The story is very intriguing and you can't help but wonder, [i]"what, why and how?"[/i]

I only have two complaints really, the stupid elevators and the floating balls of death that always seem to catch me when I’m stuck trying to figure out how to put it where. But the overall experiance is [b]fantastic[/b].

[i]I fully recommend this game[/i], and for the price it's worth that and more. You really have no reason to not at least try this game. 

[b]<3[/b]
amazing,
Nie będę się rozpisywać - "Portal" to klasyk, w który trzeba po prostu choć raz w życiu zagrać. Jest oryginalny, o bogatej historii i zmusza do ruchu szare komórki.
Świetna gra zmuszająca głównie do myślenia, a czasami i refleksu.

This was a triumph.

I'm making a note here:

HUGE SUCCESS.

It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.

Aperture Science

We do what we must because we can.

For the good of all of us.

Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying over every mistake.

You just keep on trying till you run out of cake.

And the Science gets done.

And you make a neat gun.

For the people who are still alive.

I'm not even angry.

I'm being so sincere right now.

Even though you broke my heart.

And killed me.

And tore me to pieces.

And threw every piece into a fire.

As they burned it hurt because I was so happy for you!

Now these points of data make a beautiful line.

And we're out of beta.

We're releasing on time.

So I'm GLaD, I got burned.

Think of all the things we learned for the people who are still alive.

Go ahead and leave me.

I think I prefer to stay in side.

Maybe you'll find someone else to help you.

Maybe Black Mesa

THAT WAS A JOKE.

HAHA, FAT CHANCE.

Anyway, this cake is great.

It's so delicious and moist.

Look at me still talking when there's Science to do.

When I look out there, it makes me GLaD I'm not you.

I've experiments to run.

There is research to be done.

On the people who are still alive.

And believe me I am still alive.

I'm doing Science and I'm still alive.

I feel FANTASTIC and I'm still alive.

While you're dying I'll be still alive.

And when you're dead I will be still alive.

STILL ALIVE

STILL ALIVE

I already finished and reviewed Portal 2 on Steam, praising it as one of the best ever game I ever played, although it is just the sequel of the first Portal. Is Portal as good as Portal 2? My answer is no, but it features the same great concept that gave birth to its masterpiece sequel. I wouldn't recommend this game, but the concept is so great I don't feel like not recommending it.


[b][u]PROS[/u][/b]
[list]

[*][u]GAME MECHANICS[/u]: Just like Portal 2, it shares the same mechanics, the very ingenious portals never seen in any other game, gravity and objects to solve puzzles. There's not much to say, it's just unique and ingenious, it's great if you're looking for something new for your brain.

[*][u]PUZZLES[/u]: Puzzles are very nice, I love solving them, although they are not so difficult sometimes, probably they are meant for the new players still not into the game's logic. 

[*][u]AGING[/u]: Some great games have a curse called aging, they were great games back when they were released, nowadays they aged bad and looking so bad. It's not Portal's case, the game aged great and looking pretty good, thanks to the good Half Life 2 decent graphic engine and the semplicity of the maps. It's very enjoyable and not too far from Portal 2, it's still a pleasure to play it today.


[/list]


[b][u]CONS[/u][/b]
[list]

[*][u]LONGEVITY[/u]: The campaign and story is way too short, I could complete it twice with half achievement in about 5 hours. That's very disappointing because a game can't be that short while being a single player only with no support for custom maps, challenges made the game a bit longer but they are not as good as the story. Thumbs down for being so quick.

[*][u]WORKSHOP[/u]: Another weak point is the lack of the workshop, custom maps could have made the game much longer and enjoyable, it's a shame they didn't think about it, but it's available for Portal 2.

[*][u]UNBALANCED DIFFICULTY[/u]: Portal lacks of difficulty balance, the story's puzzles are very easy, much easier than Portal 2, the challenges are way too hard if played with no walkthrough. There's no middle way.

[*][u]MINOR BUGS[/u]: I went through some minor bugs, some were rare but quite bad, others not so serious. I went through them mostly during challenges, I had the steps counter going up while standing on the cube on the moving platform, hitting objects while running can add a lot of steps despite you're standing on the same point, if you're hit by turrets, the counter highly increase. I experienced 2 serious bugs, one made my last savegame crash the game everytime it was loaded (luckly the autosave did a great job, unlike many other games), the other bug I solved a puzzle to open the door, despite everything was activated, the door didn't open, it was a bad one because it was the step challenge and couldn't just reload and finish it easily again. 

[*][u]PORTAL 2[/u]: Portal 2 is just the first Portal with everything fixed and added, even if this game is great, I wouldn't see any point to buy it. It happens when the sequel doesn't feature any major changes but mostly fixes of the old version, that's exactly why I would recommend Portal 2 more than this.

[*][u]PRICE[/u]: The price is not too high if you don't consider all the cons I listed, unfortunately it's pretty senseless to buy it. Why should I spend this much for a 2 hours long story, a few challenges for a dozen extra hours, no multiplayer or coop, no custom maps and nothing truly different than Portal 2? Its price should be much lower because this game is ingenious and revolutionary, but way too short and incomplete compared to the sequel. It's a good choice to buy The Orange Box with a discount instead, Half Life 2 is a great game and Portal is included into the box.


[/list]

Final word: The original project that gave birth to the masterpiece called Portal 2, it's as smart as short. Recommended only with a huge discount for The Orange Box, otherwise better skip to Portal 2, which is complete.

Açık konuşayım. Valve'ın oyunlarına karşı hiçbir zaman çok fazla ilgi beslemedim. İnsanların genel olarak Valve'a yaklaşımını fazla abartı buluyor , oyunlarının sanıldığı ve anlatıldığı kadar mükemmel olduğunu düşünmüyordum. Aslına bakarsak hala daha öyle düşünüyorum. Fakat bu kötü oyun yaptıkları anlamını taşımıyor. Evet , Valve kaliteli yapımlarla karşımıza geliyor , fakat bunların bazıları benim açımdan başarılı iken bazıları ise yetersiz kalıyor. Portal , kesinlikle bu kısımlardan başarılı olan tarafta yer alıyor ve hakkında söylenen yorum ve incelemeleri de herşeyiyle hak ediyor ...

Öncelikle oyunun bir birinci şahıs , platform ve bulmaca oyunu olduğunu ve bilim-kurgu temasında geçtiğini belirteyim. 

Kocaman bir laboratuvara kapatılmış olan karakterimizin kim olduğunu ve neden oraya kapatıldığını bilmiyoruz. Tek bildiğimiz , yapay zekâlı bir robotun arkadan bize bir takım komut ve mesajlar vermesi ile bizim bir teste tabi tutulduğumuz. Ve testi geçersek sonunda pastaya ulaşabileceğimiz. Önümüze sunulan tüm bu bulmacaları çözmeye çalışırken yapay zekâlı robotun arka planda kara mizâh unsuru barındıran diyalogları , elimizde portal yaratabildiğimiz bir silah ve zekice hazırlanmış eğlenceli bulmacalar...İşte Portal'ın özeti. 

Dışarıdan bakıldığında bu oyunun neden bu kadar övüldüğünü anlamakta bir çoğumuz gibi bende güçlük çekiyordum. Ta ki oynayınca nedenini anladım. 
Oyun elindeki unsurları o kadar yerinde ve miktarında kullanmıştı ki hiçbir şekilde bulmacalarda aşırı zorluk veya kolaylık , esprilerde yapmacıklık veya sıradanlık , oynanışta herhangi bir eksiklik hissetmiyorsunuz. Bulmacalar tam olması gerektiği gibi gerçekten düşündürücü ve özenle hazırlanmış. Bazen gözünüzün önündeki çözümü göremeyip uzun süre kafa patlattığınız olabiliyor. İşte burada da oyunun size sunduğu hayalgücü unsuru çıkageliyor. Oyun belki bulmaca çözümleri konusunda sizi fazla özgür bırakmayıp kendi istediği şekilde çözmenizi istiyor , ama çözüm aşamasında bile hayalgücünüzü kullanıp hesaplayarak doğru yola sapıyorsunuz. "Nasıl yapabilirim ?", "Burayı geçmem imkansız !" dediğiniz anlarda bile küçücük bir boşluktan çözümü kendiniz bulabiliyorsunuz. Tüm bu bulmacalarla uğraşırken yapay zekâlı robotun gerçekten kaliteli mizah barındıran konuşmaları oyuna ayrı bir renk katıyor.

Oynanışa yakından bakmak gerekirse , elimizdeki portal silahı ile oyunun bize belirttiği duvarlara portallar açıp ilerliyoruz. Tabi bu sınırsız değil. Portal sayımız 2 ile sınırlı , mavi ve turuncu renklerini kullanabiliyoruz. İsteğe bağlı renkleri değiştirebiliyoruz. Aynı zamanda zaman zaman bize yardımcı olan belli başlı oyun içi unsurlardan ; momentum ve fizik kurallarından faydalanabiliyoruz. 

Ekstra olarak oyunun , arka planda neler olduğunu bir sır gibi saklaması ve bulunduğumuz ortamın aslında psikolojik olarak ürpertici olması Portal'ın atmosferini beğenmemi sağladı. Seslendirmeyi başarılı bulduğumu ve oyunun ana soundtrack ini de çok sevdiğimi söylemek isterim.

Portalın belki benim açımdan tek hayalkırıklığı yaratan noktası oyunun çok kısa olması. Oyunları uzun uzun tadını çıkarta çıkarta oynayan birisi olmama rağmen oyun sadece 5 saatte bitti , ve credits ekranına bakarken " Hayır , bitmiş olamaz..." demiştim. Ekstra olarak aynı bulmacaların zorlaştırılmış madalyalı modları da mevcut , fakat oyunun kendisi maalesef fazla kısa. Ama dolu.

Bunun gibi bir oyunda senaryo ne kadar güzel ve etkili olabilir ki , demeyin. Bazen küçücük bir replik , küçücük bir sahne , küçücük bir sekans bile içinizde bir his uyandırıp size bir duygu katabilir. Tıpkı Portal'ın finali gibi :)

Muito criativo, apesar da campanha curta demais.

The design, the music, the perspective (how you "experience" the protagonist you are controlling) make Portal one of the best and most immersive dystopian science fiction games on Steam.

The story may be quite short, still maintaining a high quality and fine 'implementation' into the overall game design and experience. However, the advanced chambers and challenges as well as the possibility to play 'Bonus Maps' found on the Internet (e.g. the Flash Version) guarantee many more hours of puzzle-solving than the story alone offers.

Further, it's nice that the developers abstain from the 'voyeurism' many games with female characters display...

Portal não é apenas um game de puzzle, mas um game completamente incrível em cada pixel seu.

Puzzles desafiadores e inteligentes, uma vilã mega carismática que não passa de apenas uma voz, história misteriosa, mas, ainda assim, riquíssima, totalmente aberta a teorias, segredos a serem descobertos, e um bolo!

Sua única arma é um dispositivo que cria portais, de entrada e saída, e com ele, vc faz as coisas mais absurdas, usando sempre a física ao seu favor.

Portal vale muito a pena, pode comprar com toda a certeza que é diversão garantida.. mas lembre-se:


O bolo é uma mentira!

Рекомендую

The initial levels introduced you to the concept of portals, game mechanics, play style and controls. The physics of the movement feel like a standard FPS, but add two portals and you have a whole bunch of new tricks up your sleeve! Ironically once you get your portal gun, the game stops feeling like another FPS. It looks like a shooter to on observer, yet it plays like a puzzler but with the new portal physics. I was recommended this game a long time ago, but I had never played it until now, I found it to be extremely fun and everything it had been hyped up to be.

You feel like a lab rat running a deadly maze, armed with your trusty portal gun and the promise of cake. You eventually find out all is not all as it seems, with secret rooms and crazed messages from other test subjects, making you thirst for more information about what is going on, who you are, and why you are here.

The first few levels really show you how the new portal physics can be worked to your advantage, how to grab things like crates to throw switches that open doors (familiar to the original Zelda puzzles), then new skills where timing your shots is thrown in the mix. A new switch is then introduced in the form of a deadly floating ball of plasma that you need to put back in its home. The gradual build-up of skills is in the Goldilocks zone, it’s not too hard, not too easy, it's just right. Whenever you feel stuck you just need to stop and look for the signs, because there is always a path to follow to get to the end of the level. There are signs in the form of visual cues (like lighting effects highlight a point of interest) to show you the order of the maze and its puzzle pieces. I found these subtle cues a great part of the game, as it helps the player navigate each step. The players can always see the WHERE, the challenge is figuring out HOW to get to the next bit. It usually involves improving upon already developed skills built on the previous levels. This gives the game a steady, natural flow.

So, I felt the game had a good flow, it starts with easy levels that progressively get harder as they balance your skill set accordingly. With each level being long enough to entertain, but also short enough to quickly jump on and just finish a single level. I spent many hours playing in one sitting which felt to me like minutes.
Short and sweet, a classic puzzle game that everyone should play.
Though somewhat short, Portal is a fantastic experience years later. Highly recommended.
This is should be a standard game when downloading Steam.
